text.tspan: Goal: place labels outside the pie
without overlapping it, while being on
center of the slice and having
center of the whole text bounding box
This is for when the origin is at (0,0) but we were in
(centerX,centerY) so adjust the x and y:
The x and y specified for the canvas in Android
denotes the position of the baseline of the text
and not its center or bottom edge.
Shift the x and y so that it is the center of the text
that is placed on the desired point (circumference)
and not the baseline of the text.
This also makes future calculations easier.
Now, calculate the shift (a,b) to move the rectangle along
the middleAngle just enough so that it does not overlap
The formula for this shiftring differes for different
First, convert the middleAngle to its first-quadrant (0≤θ≤90)
equivelant (if it is in a quadrant other than the first quadrant)
because our formulae do correct calculations only for angles
Note that the quadrent shown here is the one generally
considered the first quandrant in mathematics but
in Android it is the bottom right quadrant that is the
first quadrant. However, it does not make any
Convert the shift (a,b) to the middleAngle
Finally, shift the x and y:
To place the text with a margin, imagine
a bigger disk that you want to put the rectangle
on it. So instead of pieRadius, use pieRadius + margin:
Again, don't forget to account for centerX and centerY.
